Created attachment 29674
examples

specifying a source-resolution different from 72 affects the size of fonts if the font-size attribute is specified. no impact is seen if the font-size is not specified. note that this is independent of SVG.

the attached example, together with fop.xconf for different source-resolutions, exemplify the issue. the example is for PDF but the same happens with PostScript and other output formats.

creator: lmpmbernardo@gmail.com
text: I thought more about this and came to the conclusion that it does make sense that the font sizes specified as a number (i.e., not a length) be scaled the same way images are when the source-resolution is not the default one. So this is a non bug.
